{"step_by_step_thinking": "Hydrocephalus in a neonate is characterized by an enlarged head due to the accumulation of cerebrospinal fluid, so option a) is incorrect. The sunset sign is a clinical sign observed in infants with hydrocephalus where the eyes appear driven downward, so option b) is incorrect. The crack pot sign is also a sign of hydrocephalus, characterized by a peculiar sound when the infant's head is percussed, so option c) is incorrect. The fontanelle in hydrocephalus is typically bulging, not depressed, so option d) is correct.", "answer_choice": "C. bd"}
